sourcesContent:
export const blogData = [
    {
        id: 1,
        title: 'What is JPanel in Java with Examples',
        description: 'In this tutorial, we will discuss the JPanel which is a class of Java Swing Package that is extended from the Java AWT package.',
        date: 'March 9, 2022',
        image: 'https://cdn.educba.com/academy/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/JPanel-in-Java-1.png',
        url: 'https://www.codespeedy.com/what-is-jpanel-in-java-with-examples/'
    },
    {
        id: 2,
        title: 'What is JFrame in Java with Examples',
        description: 'This tutorial discusses about JFrame used for creating lightweight window applications.',
        date: 'March 8, 2022',
        image: 'https://i.morioh.com/2021/10/15/2496fcc5.webp',
        url: 'https://www.codespeedy.com/what-is-jframe-in-java-with-examples/'
    },
    {
        id: 3,
        title: 'How to Close JFrame on Button Click in Java',
        description: 'In this tutorial, we will focus on how to Close JFrame on Button Click. We use ActionListener class and dispose() method to achieve this.',
        date: 'Feb 26, 2022',
        image: 'https://cdn.codespeedy.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/ButtonClick.png',
        url: 'https://www.codespeedy.com/how-to-close-jframe-on-button-click-in-java/'
    },
    {
        id: 4,
        title: 'How to Detect Screen Resolution of a Device in Java',
        description: 'This tutorial focuses on how to detect the screen resolution of a device in Java. We use the getScreenSize() method for achieving this.',
        date: 'Feb 6, 2022',
        image: 'https://www.codevscolor.com/static/e9b09f95c843f977a321e52608030474/79d30/java-current-resolution-screen.png',
        url: 'https://www.codespeedy.com/how-to-detect-screen-resolution-of-a-device-in-java/'
    },
    {
        id: 5,
        title: 'How to Add an Image in JFrame',
        description: 'Adding an Image in Java JFrame ... Firstly, we create a JLabel using the Java Swing library. Secondly, we use the setIcon() method to add and display the image.',
        date: 'Feb 6, 2022',
        image: 'https://stackhowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/08/How-to-display-an-image-on-JFrame-in-Java-Swing-800x445.png',
        url: 'https://www.codespeedy.com/how-to-add-an-image-in-jframe/'
    },
    {
        id: 6,
        title: 'How to set JFrame Size according to the Screen',
        description: 'Firstly, we use getScreenSize() method of the Java Toolkit class to get the resolution of the screen in dots per inch. Secondly, we use the frame.setSize() to ...',
        date: 'Jan 31, 2022',
        image: 'https://stackhowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/08/How-to-Set-JFrame-in-Center-of-the-Screen.png',
        url: 'https://www.codespeedy.com/set-jframe-size-according-to-the-screen/'
    },
    {
        id: 7,
        title: 'How to Add a Custom Cursor in JFrame',
        description: 'In this tutorial, we have discussed to create a Custom Cursor in Java. We achieve this by the createCustomCursor() method of Toolkit class.',
        date: 'Jan 30, 2022',
        image: 'https://i.ytimg.com/vi/5HCOM6E8ydc/maxresdefault.jpg',
        url: 'https://www.codespeedy.com/how-to-add-a-custom-cursor-in-jframe/'
    },
    {
        id: 8,
        title: 'How to Change JFrame Background Color in Java',
        description: 'In this tutorial, we focus on how to change JFrame background color in Java. We use setBackground() method from Java Swing to achieve this.',
        date: 'Jan 22, 2022',
        image: 'https://i.ytimg.com/vi/XZzamQuo8Nk/maxresdefault.jpg',
        url: 'https://www.codespeedy.com/how-to-change-jframe-background-color-in-java/'
    },
    {
        id: 9,
        title: 'How to Exit JFrame on Close in Java Swing',
        description: 'This tutorial focuses on how to exit JFrame on close in Java Swing. The approaches such as JFrame and Window Constants are clearly explained.',
        date: 'Jan 19, 2022',
        image: 'https://i.ytimg.com/vi/ZD6626aW54M/maxresdefault.jpg',
        url: 'https://www.codespeedy.com/how-to-exit-jframe-on-close-in-java-swing/'
    },
    {
        id: 10,
        title: 'How to change JLabel font style and size in Java',
        description: 'We use various parameters of the Font() function to change the font size of JLabel. The Font() function has three parameters as Font Style, Font Weight, and ...',
        date: 'Jan 13, 2022',
        image: 'https://stackhowto.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/08/How-to-Change-Font-Size-and-Font-Style-of-a-JLabel.png',
        url: 'https://www.codespeedy.com/how-to-change-jlabel-font-style-and-size-in-java/'
    }
]
